Class Camera

java.lang.Object
  de.tum.ws2010.propra.raytracer.render.Camera
Direct Known Subclasses:
ThreadedCamera
public class Camera
extends java.lang.Object

Camera for the raytracer.

Author:
(c) 2009-11 Roland Fraedrich (fraedrich@tum.de)

Constructor Detail

Camera

public Camera(Vector3d position,
              Vector3d lookAt,
              Vector3d up,
              double fieldOfViewY)
Constructor with position, look-at, up-vector and field of view.

Parameters:
position - Origin of the camera.
lookAt - Look at direction.
up - Up direction.
fieldOfViewY - Vertical field of view.

Camera

public Camera(double fieldOfViewY)
Constructor with field of view only. Initial position is (0,0,0), up-vector is (0,1,0) and look-at is (0,0,-1).

Parameters:
fieldOfViewY - Vertical field of view.

Camera

public Camera(Camera cam)
Copy constructor.

Parameters:
cam - Camera to be copied
Method Detail

setPositionAndViewingDirection

public void setPositionAndViewingDirection(Vector3d position,
                                           Vector3d viewingDir,
                                           Vector3d up)
Sets the position, viewing direction and up vector of the camera.

Parameters:
position - Position of the camera.
viewingDir - Viewing direction of the camera.
up - Up vector of the camera. Has not to be orthogonal to the viewing direction, but must not be parallel to it.

setPositionAndLookAt

public void setPositionAndLookAt(Vector3d position,
                                 Vector3d lookAt,
                                 Vector3d up)
Sets the parameters of the camera based on the position, a look-at point and the up-vector.

Parameters:
position - Position of the camera.
lookAt - Look at point of the camera.
up - Up vector of the camera. Has not to be orthogonal to the viewing direction, but must not be parallel to it.

initImageSettings

protected void initImageSettings(java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
Initializes the image settings based on the properties of the given BufferedImage.

Parameters:
img - BufferedImage that implicitly defines the resolution of the camera.

createRay

protected Ray createRay(int pixX,
                        int pixY)
Creates a single ray for a given pixel.

Parameters:
pixX -
pixY -
Returns:
Ray from the camera's origin through the given pixel.

renderImage

public void renderImage(Scenery s,
                        java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
Renders an image of a scene via raytracing.

Parameters:
s - Scene to be rendered.
img - BufferedImage to store the resulting image.

renderColorOf1stHit

public void renderColorOf1stHit(Scenery s,
                                java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
Renders an image by setting each pixel value to the color of the first intersected object.

Parameters:
s - Scene to be rendered.
img - BufferedImage to store the resulting image.

renderDepth

public void renderDepth(Scenery s,
                        java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
Renders an image by setting each to a grey value representing the distance of the first intersection to the camera. The grey values are scaled such that the nearest intersection point of the scene is white and the most distance one is black.

Parameters:
s - Scene to be rendered.
img - BufferedImage to store the resulting image.

renderNormals

public void renderNormals(Scenery s,
                          java.awt.image.BufferedImage img)
Renders an image by setting the color value of each pixel according to the normal at the first intersection. Here, red, green and blue represent the normal's absolute value in x, y and z direction respectively.

Parameters:
s - Scene to be rendered.
img - BufferedImage to store the resulting image.
